reviews.review_msg: It more of the material in the class that sucks, not so much Rosie's teaching ability. I found she was clear and exams were fair. However, this course covers way too much topic, basically Bio 12 with more detail. Good prof, but would not recommend the course if you're not a big science student.
Meh.... It would've been nice to have a TA who was excited about the material.
Really Easy TA.. very laid back., lets you out early the majority of his tutorials.. covers most of the material explained in lecture.. all in all a good TA
Great class, explains concepts really well. Doesn't make the best jokes though.

There's a lot to memorize but it is not a difficult class at all! I don't have a kin or bio background and I did well in this course. The exams are very straight forward. Angela is an amazing professor and a nice person.

Just to prove the course wasn't a "slam dunk", the prof included in the course 2 midterms and a final (all cumulative), a written assignment, a group presentation, and pop quizzes nearly every single tutorial. Study off ppt notes and you should be fine. Just alot of tedious work involved.

She is an amazing professor. Her lectures are clear, informative, and interesting. She was "new" when I took her in Spring 2009 and she was fabulous. I know a lot of these ratings are subjective, but I believe students should take her class(es) at some point. Her midterms and exams were based on both notes and textbook so study and you'll do great!

he is amazing, i've never seen a prof like him! he really cares about students, take to him if you have any problem about the course or midterms and he'll be more than happy to help. again if you wanna an A in kin 140, take it with him.

Wonderful wonderful prof...I have no bad things to say about him, I absolutely loved him! As long as you pay attention to the class and study for exams (read textbook to understand, not simply to memorize) you will do well in his class!

This class requires more work than I imagined - you definitely have to work hard to get that A. Lectures are really not mandatory since vineet reads everything from the powerpoint notes. Mid-terms are fair but final was very brutal, he expects us to finish a 3-hr exam in 2 hrs.

Reading everything off the powerpoint slides and doesn't speak clearly sometimes. He's not as funny as what people claimed, which doesn't really help because it's 8:30 lecture. Not really a GPA booster because you REALLY have to work hard for that A.

Vineet!!!!!!! This guy is amazing!  He's hilarious, keeps you listening, he enjoys profanity, he is animated, loud and somehow manages to teach the class a ton of stuff without u even realizing it.  I'll take any course this proff offers at SFU.

Vineet is one of the best profs I have ever had, he made lectures so interesting! His exams are straightforward and he is always willing to help out-He always makes a point to get to know his students -One of the nicest profs I have encountered in my four years of post secondary.

Tough class. First two midterms were fine if you studied, but the final sucked. There were a few questions on it that made no sense, that weren't in the lecture notes or even covered that much in class. My advice: study hard, real hard. This guy loves his percentages and details too, so heads up.

He just emailed us the notes and told us to print it out and he read over the notes with his ppt slides in class. No need to attend lecture cause all he does it read the notes to you. 3 midterms, 1st was super easy and the others start getting harder. Final was pretty hard. In terms of assignments, he was a super easy marker. Def a GPA booster.
Great prof! The best Kin prof I've had at SFU!!! The material wasn't too difficult but if you ever had a question she was more than willing to help out! Great Prof for Kin 110 and 142 as well!
She is passionate  in what she teaches, and encourages you to apply the things you learn. She is a role model.

Hands down the best proff I've had. If you attend class and just sit there and listen she is so good at explaining that you just understand. For a two hour lecture that starts at 8 30 basically everyone was engaged and listening. Her midterms are completely fair.
The best prof I've had yet! She is clearly passionate about the subject - funny and makes the course really interesting. I had an 830 class but never had any trouble staying awake in class
Diana is awesome! The midterm was super easy however, the final was a little tricky but overall it was a easy course. She is an amazing prof and she makes class super interesting :)

Awesome prof! She's super interesting and relates much of the material to her personal life. She has a very fun personality and likes to make jokes a lot. Exams were easy especially mt and assignments were a breeze.  She makes kin so interesting, I would love to take another course with her if I could! :)

Easiest GPA booster you will ever take. She's an awesome prof who keeps everyone awake during morning lectures. Very relateable prof and the exams are straight memorization and a breeze. Ended up with an A+ and studied 4 hours for the final. Not a lot of work. Definitely suggest taking this course as an easy A and its interesting too!
Awesome prof, very passionate and will wake you up during the 8:30am lecture. Uses i-clickers for attendance. Weekly tutorial quizes however are quite annoying.

Easy A. Interesting lectures. Hilarious prof. Extremely understanding. Exams are easy. Assignments are actually enjoyable to do. LOVED her class! If I wasn't a business major, I'd go into kin because of her. Class is a cake walk but it's still really enjoyable and entertaining. As a person, she's fantastic.
Take her class if you can!!! Best instructor ever, course is easy as well. Diana makes you excited on the day you have her class.
Great Prof. Fantastic teacher and very helpful Highly recommend Diana
I took both KIN 110, 140 with her and SHE WAS THE GREAT. She is the model of the best professor. I love you, Diana!!!!!!!
Amazing and enthusiastic prof, and exams are all so easy. Definitely a GPA booster, highly recommended!
awesome prof, really passionate about what she teaches. Easy course also, even if your not a "science" type!

this class is a gpa booster for sure. I love Diana, great prof, very passionate. Assignments were time consuming, lots of material to know for midterm. final is cumulative but mc is easy. 3rd yr crim student and this was my fave class of the semester! very interesting

I love Diana, she is awesome and very inspiring! Really knows how to teach material in a way that engages students. I have no interest in science whatsoever, so thankfully the class material was brief yet informative. I loved this class, highly recommended!

very unfair prof. didn't care about anything at all. found out that half of the stuff we learned from her was wrong. was never available for help and never answered emails until a week later. also completeley uncoordinated with TA's.

very unfair prof. was often late for class. seemed like she copied her notes off wikipedia. also found out this semester that half of the stuff we learned from her was wrong. wasn't coordinated with TA's at all. made exams hard and asked questions we didn't learn. Also was never available for help. took a week to answer emails too
Took this class with her in summer of 2010. She was awesome. Exams are easy. Homework is time consuming. Her lectures are usually fun. She is very passionate about her "sex lectures." Excellent prof

Very carismatic and energetic instructor. However, this semester she made exams super hard on the later parts which included many questions that were not even mentioned in the text or notes. She probably thought her exams were too easy. Questions for BCP project were vague and marked hard. Work loads were time consuming. Didn't enjoy this class.

Shes amazing!She is full of  energetic,personal feedback and helpful hints!Very funny too!Very clear and always prepared!She cares about her students very much!Midterms are 98&straight from lec slides or txt!Chose of own topic for presentation,BCP project was very easy for perfect marks, h/w very time consuming!

I'm an Arts kid, but Dianna made me enjoy KIN. She is bubbly and energetic, full of personal feedback and helpful hints. Very clear and always prepared. Fair marker, ensures all TAs on same page. Many reminders and updates throughout semester. She cares abt students' grades but also about their health. A true inspiration.
BEST PROF EVER!!!!! Extremely intelligent and is an awesome lecturer! You can tell she loves teaching this course

This guy never once posted anything throughout the entire semester and only showed up for the final. Final was cumulative and our TM told us anything was fair game. Read an entire textbook + a million online articles. I spent more work on this course than any of my 300 level writing intensive courses. What a joke. (online course)

Good way to get your science credit if your an arts student. For the exams, make good use of the quizzes as they will prepare you for the exams. Took this class and Arch 131 with Dennis Sandgathe for my science credit, liked Arch 131 more, but this class was not bad for a science credit as well.
Tony was entertaining.  I had to take this course for science breadth.  Easy A.  TA was horrible; mumbled her way through every tutorial.  otherwise, good quality professor.

Overly simplify everything. Boring lectures and the lectures r not so related to the exams. The class itself is boring and the over use of textbook for exams make it even worse. No comment for the easiness of the exams cuz it depends. Overwhelming amount of memorizing.

Easy exams, but lectures are full of flawed arguments.  Maybe because it is a first year course, but he really over simplifies things.  Doesn't consider all the variables, only one and then draws conclusions based on that.
Good prof. Lectures were interesting and informative. Would take another class with him.

I took BPK 140 with him in my first semester ever at SFU (I'm third year now) and I still think about how great he was!! By far my favorite prof at SFU. Hope he teaches more courses because I will definitely be taking them. Can't say enough good things about him.
really enjoyable professor, take advantage of his teaching method, it's very laid back but teaches the content very well.
Fair, genuine and charismatic. Made the class pretty interesting and put emphasis on learning rather than memorize and regurgitate.

Awesome prof! He really seemed to care about how all of his students did and wanted us to do well. Unfortunately the tests were multiple choice which works for some but not for me. But even with being bad at multiple choice he made them fair and easy to get an A if you pay attention. Really hoping I can take him again!
Cool guy. Would definitely take another course with him. TBL > lectures

one of the best profs at sfu! very helpful, friendly and funny! although lectures are not very well related to quizzes and exams but they are interesting. learned alot from this course , again BEST prof
Peter is a great prof! Very friendly, approachable, and hilarious! Excellent and interesting class overall. I would highly recommend that you take any class with Peter if you have the chance!

Awesome, Awesome prof!! Heard he teaches 205 and 207 as well... so taking those 2 with him!! Take KIN 140 with him, easy to get along with and he's great with the fact that he lets YOU choose the grading criteria!! Choose him for this class if you can! Best Prof Ever!! :)

BEST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE!! Peter I hope you are reading this: Help a brother out on the final next Wednesday ;) By far the most fun I've ever had in a class. I'm walking out of this course with a lot more knowledge on contemporary health than I thought I would at this point when I walked in. TBL works!!

BEST. PROF. EVER. Out of all my courses, i've never been so sad that this one is condensed. It was just so awesome because he's so awesome. Super chill dude and very helpful. Not  a kin major but if he taught every single kin class I would definitely major in kin :p

Great prof, really chill. Although he got a lot of guest lecturers to do his lectures for him. Course content was quite interesting and easy. Quizzes were fair. Really recommend this course with Peter!

Incredible experience taking this course with Peter. I have never taken a course that used "team based learning" before but I truly enjoyed this class. A fun and fair way to learn contemporary health. My only complaint was that I found tutorial quizzes unnecessary because of the RAT quizzes. Textbook was easy to follow and an interesting read

Hint: if taking this online do the practice midterm provided on WebCT. Half the questions were exact replica's of it!! Short answer is half the exam so be able to write detailed lists/definitons/examples
Unreasonable expectations, not helpful at all regarding exam content/format: ("Everything from all material is fair game. Make sure you understand all the content and you'll be fine").
Super HARD!!!!!
A good course overall. I would recommend this course. The TAs were quite helpful and mark fair. Penny on the other hand marks quite hard.

She's an amazing prof and her notes are so helpful. The slides have most of the info but attendance is a must because she adds more things in lectures and that is the stuff she tests the most. She loves acronyms. If you  go to class and study your notes, you'll get an awesome mark for sure. Highly recommend her.

Assignments were straight forward and fair. Midterms and Final were pure memorization, so if you are great at memorization you'd do very well. The topics were quite interesting and can be applied to every day stuff so some of the materials basically are common sense.

She's OK, the course is interesting.  As others have mentioned, don't bother reading the book, everything you'll ever need is in the notes.  I asked her once why do we need the text.  She didn't have an answer...
easiest course, just listen in lectures, memorize her notes...and you'll ace the midterms! assignments are easy too.

Exams consist of what she leaves blank on her lecture slides (so print them off and fill them in).  Also she stands with her legs wide open in lecture and is NOT HOT.  Her voice makes me cringe.  The TA was nice though (she was hot).
Penny is a great teacher. She's organized, clear and very helpful. The class itself was pretty easy.
super easy class, very practical and useful.  penny is great. shes clear and also very helpful. midterm and final are easy. recommended to take for an easy A

Penny is an awesome instructor.  Her notes are very clear and she really knows her stuff.  She is a very clear speaker and is always willing to help (on webCT)! Online discussions take time, but its an easy 10%.  I think the tutorials are the most useless part of the class.

Says umm... WAY too much!  Online discussions are a waste of time and are worth very little.  She was okay but all she does is read from the projector - then again how else can you teach a course like this.

Great class & great teacher. Study the class notes/not the textbook. Not too many assignments. Tests are challenging but is you study the notes & pay attention in class, you can easily pass them. Very nice teachers, would take another class with him in a second

Penny is great she is into detalis but she put a lot of effort into making the detalis clear and if you study her class slides and do the online quizes you'll have no problem. its a great class and the ta's are great too.

Great class... for someone who isnt a kin or science major, Penny made this class extremely interesting and enjoyable. Will recommend this class to anyone. Examines are a bit tough, but she is always willing to give you a hand when you need it.
great teacher, class isnt that bad either
great prof, wouldn't say easy but overall good class
excellent communication: very clear, detailed, and informative; very helpful & organized
soo easy!!! take this if you want your gpa to go up

Hands down the best TA I've ever had in my entire 4 years at SFU. Took this course DE (Fall 2011) & I have never had such a helpful, responsive, and student-centered TA or prof in my life. I have no doubt she is a successful professor as well

i had him as a TA and he was extremly helpful. he knew his stuff more than our prof who clearly needs to take the coarse again herself. i thought leigh is a easy marker. definetly a GPA booster. thanks leigh!!!
Pasionate about what he teaches. Responds to emails quite rapidily. Would recommend others to take a class with him, or to be in his tutorial.
Great TA, he has some interesting stories to tell. Is helpful and readily available.

Took this in summer of 2012 and it was my most favourite class ever! Material is easy to understand. Midterms were quite easy. Everything was based from his power point notes that you can print out. So glad I got took this class.

Jim is truly a nice guy. He is really clear at explaining the material and connects it well to life outside of school. He encourages questions and is willing to answer questions even before the midterm. He is always on time. Exams are easy if you know your stuff.
